ch.nolix.system.application

Class DialogClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.system.application.Client<DialogClient>
      • ch.nolix.system.application.DialogClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Abortable, OptionalSignable

    public final class DialogClient
extends Client<DialogClient>
    A dialog client is a client that provides an accessible dialog.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DialogClient(Application<DialogClient> targetApplication)
      Creates new dialog client that will connect to the given target application.
      DialogClient(Dialog<?> dialog, Application<DialogClient> targetApplication)
      Creates new dialog client with the given dialog that will connect to the given target applicaiton.
      DialogClient(Dialog<?> dialog, java.lang.String ip, int port, java.lang.String targetApplication)
      Creates new dialog client with the given dialog that will connect to the given target application on the given port on the machine with the given ip.
      DialogClient(DuplexController duplexController, Session<DialogClient> initialSession)
      Creates new dialog client with the given duplex controller and the given initial session.
      DialogClient(java.lang.String ip, int port, java.lang.String targetApplication)
      Creates new dialog client that will connect to the given target application on the give port on the machine with the given ip.
